reasons: Most consistent version; More accurate verse numbers
output:
1 O come, let us sing to the Lord, let us make a joyful noise to the rock of our salvation.
2 O come into his presence with thanksgiving, let us make a joyful noise to him with songs of praise.
3 For the Lord is a great God, a great King above all gods.
4 In his hands are the depths of the earth, and the mountains are all his, and the sea, for he made it, and the dry land, which his hands have formed.
3 O come, let us worship and bow down, let us kneel before the Lord, for he is our Maker.
4 O come into his presence with thanksgiving, let us make a joyful noise to him with songs of praise.
5 For the Lord is our God, we are the people of his land, like the sheep in the pasture of his hand.
6 O that today you would hear, do not harden up your hearts, as you did in the wilderness.
7 Your ancestors tested me and put me to the proof, even though they had seen my work.
8 For forty years I loathed that generation, and said,
9 There are people whose hearts go astray, and they do not regard my ways.
10 Therefore in anger do I swear, that they shall not enter to my rest.

4 O come into his presence with thanksgiving, let us make a joyful noise to him with songs of praise.
